Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: TopofTXtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for several nights recently, and overall enjoyed the hotel quite a bit, but with a few areas for improvement. Rooms: Typical Embassy Suites, 2 room suites. We requested and received a quiet room (away from the elevator on the top floor.) It was indeed quiet and clean. The decor is nice and relatively recent. Walls showing some wear at corners (peeling texture, paint in one area that didn't hurt anything but was noticeable.) Bath/shower combo drains fine when showering, but took quite a while to drain about 6 inches of water after baths. One evening the water wouldn't get any warmer than lukewarm for our kids to bathe, but was fine about an hour later when I showered. Beds were ok but not great, but I slept fine. Leisure: Free wifi in lobby for registered guests, but you have to pay for in room access. Pool was steadily busy but not overcrowded. It was freakishly hot one day during our stay (water temp nearly as hot as the jacuzzi, causing the entire room (indoor pool) to steam up and cloud all the windows. This was remedied by the next day. Out of pool towels on several occasions and it took quite a while to get replacements. Used towels strewn all over the place most days. My guess is that more families were traveling than usual and the standard housekeeping schedule for the pool area was not nearly enough. Precor fitness center (3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 recumbent bike, + free weights, etc., all in good working order and never crowded during my stay.) Area: Less than 1/3 mile from the Galleria, all kinds of restaurants within 2 miles throughout Addison area. Amenities: Good breakfast, Omelets/pancakes, etc. cooked to order. Free managers reception in the evening (drinks, snacks). The lobby has 2 beautiful swans that live in the fountain -- the kids absolutely loved them! Overall, we were satisfied and would return. A few maintenance issues noted above, but nothing that was a deal breaker. Staff were very friendly and helpful (as long as you didn't need pool towels in a hurry.) I spoke to management about this and he assured me they would take care of this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for a family trip to Dallas. We were very pleased with our stay. From the moment we walked through the doors, we were greated with friendly smiles and everyone was eager to help. Kenny was extremely kind and was very helpful. I have been to many hotels and have been treated very well, but he went above and beyond. He seemed so genuine with his smile and greeting and was very helpful on getting a crib to our room and providing amenitites for us. The swans were a nice touch since we were traveling with two young children. They were given lettuce to feed to the swans which was so fun for them. The indoor pool and cook to order breakfast is why we choose to stay at Embassy Suites and this one did not disappoint. Overall, we had a great experience here and will definitely return to this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: trufflestravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a business trip for a week in Dallas. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. There is ample free parking right in front of the hotel, and you can either eat in or drive/walk to a couple of nearby places, including the Galleria. The lobby of the hotel is very nice and they even have two swans who inhabit a garden style pond in the center. The happy hour is great! I found it very enjoyable to just grab a glass of wine to take up to my room and unwind, however, there were many guests enjoying the happy hour right at the bar and it seemed an enjoyable and inviting atmosphere. I ordered room service a couple of times and delivery occurred in a very reasonable and relatively short amount of time. The food quality was average in taste and presentation (I'd order it again, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat there). I had a couple of different salads and some appetizers. I also had only coffee in the morning, but there was a nice breakfast set up for guests to enjoy. The room was clean with the usual amenities. I did not use the pool or fitness center, but did take a look at the pool...it was in a nice room with good atmosphere, but the pool is pretty small (if you're planning to swim for exercise). I did ask at the front desk about running outside and they said it was safe and that I could run in either direction along the street in front of the hotel, but that there were no parks nearby. I did run outside and found the lights take a long time to change and the cars aren't messing around there...they go fast and take no consideration for pedestrians. Regardless, I enjoyed my runs because I could get outside and see the area a little bit. The weather was gorgeous (last week of January-first week of February).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing night away from the kids”
Reviews.Author: homeschool7
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent Sun. eve. as an "intown getaway" here. Mon. was the MLK holiday . This hotel is smaller than many Embassy Suites,, only 6 floors total. I really liked the smaller feeling. The rooms are the same size, with the usual amenities. We used the fitness room, it was really cold & I was glad I was wearing a sweatshirt. The cooked breakfast was great as usual. Since it was a Monday the breakfast ended at 9am (it is 10 on the weekend). They ran out of cream & milk for the coffee before 9am, & it was not refilled. Several guests came right at 9am, or a little after & the doors to the breakfast area were closed, so they could not get anything if they were late, no coffee or drink refills after that time either. However during the day this area is open. It would be nice if on a Monday holiday they served a later breakfast-this would be a great selling point for marketing specials! The desk staff is excellent, very friendly, & ready to ask about our stay or if we needed anything There are also two swans that live in the water area at this hotel, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Cowboy Weekend - Great Service good location”
Reviews.Author: SSHotelman
Reviews.Content: This was an enjoyable place to stay. We arrived to the Hotel late Friday night (After 12am) and were greeted with a warm welcomes by both the front desk person and a late night housekeeper. Both people made us feel immediately welcomed and at home. Love Embassy for their suites, it is always nice to have the extra space. We enjoyed the free breakfast each morning and our server Connie did a great job of making us feel like we were at home. She seemed genuinely interested in us and our weekend plans, she even made some great suggestions of places to see and eat at. One interesting thing about this hotel they I have not seen at any other Embassy is they have Swans living in the fountain pools. Very cool. It appeared that the large wedding party that was there enjoyed them as well; the kids were very attracted to them. I ask Connie about the Swans, she said it was the hotels signature thing that would make guest remember who they were. I defiantly will. Location was great; we went to Fort Worth on Saturday (Bass Music Hall and the Stock Yards) and on Sunday to Arlington to see the Cowboys!!! Having easy access to the freeways made getting around easy. (Hwy 75, 635, and the Tollway). We didnâ€™t make it to the Galleria but it was right next door. I will return to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Spud805
Reviews.Content: Very clean and good staff. Excellant breakfast. Close to Galleria and other locations. Had a security guard at night. Needs a smokers outpost out side the front entrance to let smokers deposit thier cig butts instead of having to throw them on the ground. Nice pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveler10019
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for both Business and Pleasure. We checked in on Wednesday ( 09/28) and checked out on Friday (09/30), We then checked back in on Friday (09/30) and out Sunday morning (10/02) keeping our business and personal stays separate. I heard the desk clerk tell the Housekeeper (Amanda) we were a "stay over" and to clean our room appropriately. The room was not cleaned until late in the afternoon after I called Housekeeping. Housekeeping said they had no record that I was a "stay over". Also despite leaving out the empty tissue box on the bathroom counter for two days, I had to go to the front desk to re-plenish our tissue supply. Despite the number of "suits" walking around (which is bothersome in itself since one always felt watched) these houskeeping problems are rather basic and could be handled with more effective oversight. The breakfast and other amenities were fine, but overshadowed by bad basic housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: carri j
Reviews.Content: my husband and I went there to enjoy a night away from the kids. The cocktail hour (5:30-7:30) was great. We had three drinks each. Our room was on the top floor and never cooled down below 74. I like my room cold. When we checked out, we told the front desk about the room being warm and he said the manager was too busy to talk to us, and never followed up. We werent looking for anything. Just a heads up on the problem with the room for the next guest. The free breakfast buffet had a great section as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ernestina15
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, we were there for our wedding aniversary, they told the shuttle driver to take us to a good restaurant to celebrate. We had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: pintailkiller
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel. Swans in the indoor fountain were a great touch of romance. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the food”
Reviews.Author: veeveenyc
Reviews.Content: Really poor room service: ordered cuban sliders...got 2 slices of salami with a few slices of pickles. (missing ham, swiss cheese, pork). ordered soup and they didn't give me a spoon. at breakfast, dishes and utensils were dirty

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzzperri
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs an upgrade! My mistake was booking this hotel because of the location (close to the galleria mall). The pool was smaller than expected and the jacuzzi was full of kids and dirty(one of the kids vomited on the outside of the jacuzzi and it was just sitting there). The room was "motel-ish" and both my daughters who slept on the pull out sofa had bumps on their arms, back and neck which was later confirm as bed bugs by their PCP....never again!! No call was returned from management

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Hilton and a better value”
Reviews.Author: adventurer1218
Reviews.Content: I found out that this Embassy Suites was very near the Hilton and the Galleria Mall and since we love the Embassy Suites product, with the complimentary breakfast and managers reception-i stayed here. The mall is within walking distance, with numerous restaurants and stores. Need I say more. Good price and great value. When we return to Dallas, we will come back and stay here again. Staff was friendly and rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GRichards”
Reviews.Author: og11824
Reviews.Content: Clean Rooms, AC not as cool As i would have liked. But overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay as always”
Reviews.Author: stulights
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this venue 18 times over the years. Service has always been extremely courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Fun shopping weekend with nieces:)”
Reviews.Author: Aquiles96
Reviews.Content: Our nieces LOVED the live swans in the lobby!! They were beautiful. We were very close to the American Girl Boutique and the Galleria Mall.... Fun weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel following good ratings from TripAdvisor members. I checked in late in the evening and was given a one bedroom suite. Check-in was very prompt and easy The foyer is an open concept with a pond for feeding the two Swans. The room was very nice and comfortable. I ordered room service a few times when I was there, but they had an issue understanding my order on all occasions. There are a number of food places just outside the hotel to eat. I was also meeting a friend at his work one night, but as the business center PCs were all being used, the manager at the check-in desk was more than extremely helpful looking up the information and location for me. They also organised a town car to take me to the location. The staff were exceptionally great and the hotel was nice. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some questions”
Reviews.Author: Verter50
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was ok. When we checked in we were told there was only one night available at the government rate. The rooms were clean but the fact that in this day and age we had to pay for internet service was unbelievable! The swans were a nice touch, but the poor things seemed as if they were never out of the water and that the area they swam in was dirty and full of feathers. These water fowl need to be on land and have the ability to swim, if they want. We really felt sorry for them. The breakfast was ok but the fruit was only honeydew melon, not refilled. No knives, the orange juice was watered down. Much better breakfasts at the Holiday Inn Express hotels. I give the over all stay a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: jlass22
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel - great breakfast and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shayna3579
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay at. They went out of there way for me. Friendly and helpful. The only minor things are the housekeeping and the breakfast and there are only minor problem. If you are going to be in the area this is where you should stay, the rooms are great. I have already booked this hotel for 2 more stays

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: IPB5TLS
Reviews.Content: Not the first time my family and I have stayed here. the Embassy Suite is in a great location, easy to get to and if you have kids they'll fall in love with the two swans that swim around the lobby pond. Want to relax and enjoy a great night sleep and a great vbreakfast every morning. This is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Seems like a mini-Embassey Suites”
Reviews.Author: cindgail
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Embassey Suites in the past. Everything seems scaled down to me. Once I got into my room I even called the front desk to make sure they had given me a King room. The "king" bed seemed like a large queen, as well as the room. I've had great memories of the breakfast area from past stays at other Embassey Suites. Again, this one seemed to have a mini version. Seemed like an upgraded continental breakfast, because of the omlette station. Kind of disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Sheets and Towels!!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzmene
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! The sheets were so uncomfortable - the thread count was like a 1!!! And, the towels were HARD!!! Two words: Fabric Softener!!!! It's going to take a gallon of baby oil to restore my skin back to his smoothness!!! Other than the cuts on my skin it's a decent hotel. I'll just remember to bring my own sheets and towels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Danrayeschler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on several times before and enjoyed the stay, however the last time I stayed here will be my last. I had my family which includes two kids. There was no blanket for the sofa sleeper so I requested one from the front desk. After about thirty minutes housekeeping brought up a wadded up bedspread. I took it down to the front desk and explained to them that this is not what I wanted. Without saying anything the lady behind the front desk left and returned a few minutes later with a blanket, which she tossed at me. We were scheduled to stay two nights here but decided to find another hotel. We sent a email to embassy suites manager and have yet to get a response back. This indicates to me that customer service doesn't come first.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: Great location near the galleria and not too far from airports. Clean rooms, good breakfast, and excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Spacious but...”
Reviews.Author: DaveySF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, clean and spacious, but don't drink the coffee in your room! I made myself a cup of coffee, put some sugar and half&half in it and within 5 minutes could feel and my stomach start churning. I think it was bad half & half they had there. How often do they cycle out that half & half? Winter travel means lots of dry skin and good lotion is a must. The body lotion there is also wimpy and does not do a good job of soothing/protecting dry skin. Other than this, breakfast is great, staff is very good and so is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and comfy”
Reviews.Author: jneuzil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple and relaxed. Kids enjoyed the live swans in the lobby. Parents enjoyed the hot cooked-to-order breakfast...omelets, hash browns, pancakes, bacon and sausage. Pool area was fun however the "hot tub" was lukewarm. Nice exercise room with TV's on the equipment. Nothing fancy here, but a good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad management and security.”
Reviews.Author: k7934
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites in general provides a good value. I have stayed at this hotel many times and had a good experience, but on this ocassion one particular weakness came glaring through. On Thanksgiving day when the hotel is packed with a football game crowd and holiday shoppers for the Galleria nearby, security was only provided for part of the night. As soon as the security guard left at 5:00 AM, thieves came through the parking lot and cleaned out more than 5 vehicles without being detected at all. Poor lighting is provided in the parking lot on the side and rear and there is a problem neighborhood nearby. Management seemed to have little concern for the customers who were robbed and did not offer anything to help. We were provided a form to fill out and I was given the phone number for a glass repair service that I had to contact. No additional discounts were offered as some consideration for our inconvenience. I had to ask for a discount and received half off of one night's rate. This seemed like an insult considering what happened and the time and trouble all of the customers will have as the result of the hotel not being willing to provide better security in their parking lot. If you are considering shopping at the Galleria for the holidays, you may want to find a hotel with better security.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here just one night and was very...”
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night and was very impressed with the service and friendliness of the staff. The hotel was very peaceful and relaxing and the two Royal Swans in the inner courtyard pool only added to the serenity that prevails here. They have a nice Precoir workout facility and pool area. Truly an enjoyable stay, a big thank you to to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Archer83
Reviews.Content: I'm writing to recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Addison in Dallas. I really enjoyed the cooked breakfast and I considered the three nights for the price of two deal to be a good bargain. The front desk staff were excellent (and very cute!) and even got me a power converter for free when I didn't have one that matched my laptop. Rooms were clean, bed very comfy etc. Only thing was - no cutlery available in the rooms and if you have any leisure/business in the city and you don't have a car you're better off saving on taxis and staying somewhere closer as the taxis drivers are bandits!

Reviews.Title: “Kid sleepovers . . . .totally strange!”
Reviews.Author: odaddy
Reviews.Content: I think I read someone else's review that stated that this hotel hosts kid sleepovers. . . apparently this is pretty popular . . . the number of kids running around the hotel was kind of annoying. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel because we were visiting family, but it was pretty noisy in the evening. The swans were beautiful, but I'd like to start a movement to "FREE BARRON AND QUEEN". I don't know anything about swans, but I can't imagine that they are happy in such a small space. Breakfast was good, but I think the dishwasher must've been broken . . . I picked up several plates that were DISGUSTINGLY dirty. Someone must've complained, the dishes were a little cleaner the next day. We like staying at E.S., but we won't be staying at this one again. We'll opt for the E.S. - Outdoor World, near the Grapevine Mills Mall.

Reviews.Title: “So welcoming...”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so good at what it does, that the only suggestion I had for them at checkout was to have peanut butter available for my breakfast bagel. Among the many benefits and conveniences: There is a pair of Royal Swans swimming around in the atrium - how's that for not feeling like you're at home? On my first of two stays in a two-week period, the housekeeper had crafted a swan out of a hand towel and left it on the bathroom vanity. There's a free shuttle to all of the many office buildings (and the GALLERIA) in the area that runs until 10 p.m. There's a CVS next door for the inevitable items you forgot to bring along. The room service lady, Carmen, made me feel right at home and fed me well both of the nights I was holed up in my room trying to beat a deadline. There is a volume control on the wall in the bathroom - you can listen to the bedroom TV while you're in the shower. How's that for cool?? A few minor "cons": The "business center" is one lonely PC loaded with one of those "restriction" packages - I wanted to pull up an urgent email attachment when I checked in, but no-go. No printer, either. Bummer. They say that they serve lunch, but when I tried to grab a sandwich on the way to my meeting there was nobody around to make one. Breakfast, however, is pretty good - omelets to order along with the usual stuff. Embassy Suites are nice hotels, sure, but this one is full of special little touches that give it a distinctive personality. If you're going to be in the area, I would recommend it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value , Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TylerREBroker
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel at least 5 times. The staff is always friendly and accomadating and the location is great. My wife and I love to stay here and walk (one half block) to Del Frisco's Steak House in the evening. It is also only about 4 blocks on side streets to the Gallaria Mall and 2 blocks to Dick's Sporting Goods......makes for a great one or two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neko786
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel was the great service from the staff. Laura at the front desk and Elena from Room Service were great. I will say the food was typical "hotel' food, but everything else was perfect. The complimentary shuttle service helped me get to my training site. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to other business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but hated the laundry”
Reviews.Author: getzigged
Reviews.Content: Dallas, the city is always buzzing, as soon as you get down at the Fortworth airport and get out, you can see some suped up trucks, mustangs raring around on the road. I took my rental car and drove down to the Embassy suites, near the Galleria. not a very fashionable but a simple looking hotel with loads of services and things to do. The rooms are big and good, as I entered mine I was welcomed by a moderate size living room sitting which was clubbed witha small kitchenette and had a pathway to the bedroom. The bedroom was of big enough size too with good selection of channels on TV. The hotel had a good gym facility and a nice indoor swimming pool, though I could never try my luck at the pool. One thing I like about the Hilton Embassy Suites was the eye for customer service delivery, so in the hotel you have Laundrette's where you can go and wash your clothes on your own if you find hotel Laundry service too expensive, just popo the change, pop the clothes, go to the bar grab a few drinks during the Manager's reception time and hey your clothes are ready too. The team kids travelling with me used to do that, I somehow preferred to use the hotel laundry, saved me the effort of ironing the clothes. :) The only time when i didn't like the hotel was when the Laundry service lost one of my Boss shirt and the manager behaved helpless and didn't do anything about it. However, the Embassy suites is the place for you to stay if you don't want to be in downtown and still want to be in centre of shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST in the area”
Reviews.Author: bostoncityliving
Reviews.Content: My family from out of state (and my husband-to-be's) came here for a week before our wedding at the Arboretum in May 2008. The staff is OUTSTANDING. They were gracious and accomodating. For example, we were there late one night after a trip to the Mesquite Rodeo (like 11ish) and everyone was in the lobby with some left over food from a party and someone went to ask for coffee and the staff brewed an entire new pot for us. They didn't act like it was an imposition. There are two swans in the lobby, and the staff doesn't freak if you get close to them. The lobby is so lovely and open with real trees and a fountain. Yet cozy at the same time. Always have cold lemon water set up for the guests. The morning breakfasts are delicous -- better than most hotel's continental breakfasts (and the breakfasts are including in the hotel price). there were made-to-order omlets, waffles, fresh fruit, bagels, yogurt, etc etc. Seriously, don't know why you would stay anywhere else when you can have all this for a reasonable price and have a very relaxing, stress-free and very Dallas experience (Galleria next door!! Right by the Dallas Tollway, access to everthing). Ample parking and you don't have to pay like the Marriott down the block. If you are traveling to Dallas and rent a car -- be sure to get the Dallas Tolltag for the tollways - it will save you sooo much hassle! This is such a "deal" for what it is. More costly hotels have nothing over this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Were Looking For!”
Reviews.Author: ksNOLA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on a recommendation from the bride and groom of the wedding we were in town for. They picked a central location to the rehearsal site, wedding, and the reception. We have never stayed at an Embassy Suites. We loved it! We were immediately greeted by energetic staff. Before we even took our bags upstairs we were told about the Manager's 'Happy Hour.' Free appetizers, wine, liquor and beer every day from 5:30pm - 7:30pm! It was a nice treat to grab a drink before heading to our room or out to dinner. Complimentary, cooked-to-order breakfast every morning too! Omelets, pancakes, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, pastries, cereal, coffee, tea, etc. They even had a fountain drink machine...I've never had complimentary breakfast that served me my Diet Coke!!! Large open atrium in the center of the hotel with the rooms circling around. I didn't think it was noisy like other reviews stated. Maybe you could request a higher level room. They have a 24 hours store in the lobby that sells snacks and toiletries. There is also a 24 CVS pharmacy practically in the same parking lot, which was very convenient. A few other notes: Courtesy shuttle will take you where you need to go; The Galleria is obviously very close; The lobby has a kiosk that allows you to check-in/check-out at the hotel and check-in for your flight; Rooms were spacious and clean; Room Service is available. Everyone in our group really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites in Dallas - Typical Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandCamper
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 1 night at the Embassy Suites in Dallas (near the Galleria) for a business trip. Memorable items: * The suite was VERY spacious, large, and clean (two tvs which I didn't watch either). The King size bed was VERY comfortable. * Loved the happy hour with FREE snacks and FREE adult beverages while socializing with my colleagues. * Loved the FREE HOT breakfast the following morning with made to order omlet * The Steak Burger and fries that I ordered from the on-site resturant was AWESOME and affordable when compared to other "hotel food" The only complaints are the following. * High speed internet cost $10 (when most other hotels give this to you for free) * There were very small little ants in running around in my bathroom. This did not prevent me from using it but my wife would have demanded another room * I didn't care for the Swans in the hotel. They should be in a park vs. a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable for our Purpose”
Reviews.Author: arkansastraveler42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for business and it was great for us. When we checked in they did not have the double bed room that we reserved but the front desk manager quickly put us in 2 adjoining rooms and comped the extra room. This actually worked out better for us so we were pleased. Del Frisco's is right across the street with fantastic steaks and the front desk also called and checked their hours of operation and made us a reservation. Our rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast buffet was a little slim but okay. The furniture was a little old and worn out but overall I thought it was worth what we paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lori Jeannine
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and this Embassy is definitely not up to Hilton standards. The service was very good, we used the hotel shuttle a few times and the front desk manager and shuttle driver were very nice and polite. Once we arrived at the Galleria, we tried to tip the driver and he declined saying he was a manager. I called when we were done and they arrived to pick us up within just a few minutes. The inside of the hotel is nice, swans are beautiful and setting is park-like. Our room was icky. The shower had mildew on the walls and some of it looked like it was even covered up by caulk. Brewed coffee was left in the pot. When we got ready to go to bed, we pulled back the sheets and they had spots and stains. (looked like blood!) We called the front desk and told them our sheets were dirty and they sent someone right up to change them. We have always been happy with Embassy but this location needs some new management in Housekeeping. Ick!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: OmahaPeter
Reviews.Content: We recently took 45 clients to Dallas and stayed at this hotel because of its location and the standard amenities offered by Embassy Suites. It was a disaster, and wish we had chosen a different hotel. We found the staff extremely difficult to work with in setting up arrangements for meals and the meetings. In our opinion, customer service and satisfaction are not in the staff's vocabulary. I was particularly embarrassed because the staff was rude to our clients, and I had booked the reservations personally.

Reviews.Title: “My review of the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: ez369
Reviews.Content: Reservation was made through my corporate travel website. I arrived late in the evening and it was nice to know my room was guaranteed. Had a room on the 6th floor (sign says floor reserved for Hilon Honors members), dunno if thats entirely true or not since I am a HH member. Walked into the room and there was a letter addressed to my name welcoming me to my room and thanking me for being a guest, etc. Thought that was a neat lil gesture. Overall I was pretty happy with the service from the front desk and housekeeping. The bartender during their evening cocktails and service staff during the breakfast were kind of dry though. I really liked the separate suite and living room arrangement. As others have mentioned, furnishings are kind of bland and certain things are showing their age. The free parking was nice and the location was great within walking distance to Del Frisco's steakhouse, a block or two from The Galleria, and a short drive to beltline.

Reviews.Title: “Poor public relations”
Reviews.Author: UnitedStatesfan
Reviews.Content: I made reservations to this hotel on 7/15/07 for a four night stay starting November 16th, 2007. (confirmation Number 83470977) After finalizing my travel plans and buying airlione tickets I called the hotel directly to change my check in date to November 17th, 2007. This was done in September 2007. I also advised the staff that I would be a late arrival since our flight did not get into Dallas until 11:30 pm and by the time I got my luggage and rental car it would probably be between 12:00am and 1:00am. I was assured that the late arrival would not be a problem and that the non-smoking room with two doubles would be available. On the morning of my flight I again called the hotel to remind the staff of my late arrival. I was again told that my room would be available. My family of five arrived at the hotel at 1:00 am. I was told by the night manager that they only had one room available and that it was a smoking room. Since my 7 year old has allergies and is sensitive to smoke I asked the manager if anything could be done to get a different room. He said that the smoking room was the only one available. Because it was already late I decided to check the room to see if it was at least clean enough to stay for the night until another room would be availabe the following day. When I was shown the room, it reeked of cigarette smoke. The room was dark and dingy and felt like a cave. The furnishings were old and soiled. I told the manager that the room was not acceptable. He said that he was sorry but that was the best that he could do. I asked if I could use the hotel phone to look for another hotel. He told me that I had to use the pay phone. When I went to the pay phone, there was no phone book. I asked the manger for a phone book and he said that he did not have one. I remembered passing a Hyatt Place one block away. I called the hotel and they had a room available for less than what I was paying at the Embassy Suites. This is where we ended up staying for the trip. It was a newly remodeled hotel with oversized rooms and a 42 inch flat panel TV. I was dissapointed with the Embassy Suies managment for not even attempting to find me a room with another Hilton family hotel for my stay and did not seem to care that they had over booked their rooms. I returned the next two days to talk Carol Chandler, the general manager but each time I was told that she was not in. I also left my cell phone number for her to call and she never did. If you are looking for a hotel near the Galleria in Dallas Texas I highly recommend the Hyatt Place which is a two minute walk to the Galleria, and not the Embassy Suites on Noel Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: d-a-n-1-e-1
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites location is in dire need of a renovation. The room I had was clean, but very worn. The TV's are at least 15 years old and there is no in room mini-bar. One of my biggest problems was that this is the first 'business' oriented hotel that I have stayed at with such a restrictive firewall policy that I could not use my VPN or my Webmail. Now this might seem like a nit to some, but for someone whose business lives and dies by email, this is no little thing. Other info: --the king bed was on the soft side --there were plenty of pillows but not enough blankets (it was in the thirties when I stayed) --it is very quiet --the indoor pool looked nice (I didn't use it)

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noisy and kids running everywhere”
Reviews.Author: melodysmiles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 1st anniversary. We thought it would be a nice place at a great price. Well, the room was nice.. but later that night when we wanted to go to sleep, there were kids running up and down in the halls and also teenagers standing around having screaming matches with each other. I don't know where their parents were, but the way this hotel is laid out, you can hear it ALL. Also the breakfast was just average, but at least it was free. I don't know if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Swans, with Kids - A+”
Reviews.Author: momof2boysSATX
Reviews.Content: Standard easy Embassy Suites stay, but this one had perqs that put it over the top. For the price especially, I'd love to stay here in any city. First, everything looked recently updated. Clean lobby, clean rooms, clean dining area. Second, the swans in the lobby were so graceful and fun to watch. They were totally well behaved. Breakfast buffet was better than most, with hot eggs cooked to order. Fabulous omlettes. Good fresh fruit. Also, a happy hour we never attended, but it looked well attended. Pool overlooked by gym area, so we could work out and swim and all look at each other. Both were uncrowded.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH!!”
Reviews.Author: tammypcarter
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed @ the Embassy Suites this past weekend to celebrate our anniversary. And boy...were we surprised at the absolute, genuine hospitality of the whole staff. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay! SO VERY CLEAN! The rooms were just the right size for us. Everyone there was so helpful. It is located so very close to restaraunts, shopping, etc. Lina (the front desk agent) is the BEST!!! We will surely stay here again. The comp breakfast was great! It was all great! NO KIDDING! Eugene (the shuttle driver) was just wonderful. My hubby and I enjoyed his conversation. Just all around great people and hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay- good location”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April 2007 for business. The hotel is a typical embassy suites layout-courtyard inside, rooms outside. The happy hour and free breakfast were pretty good as usual. The rooms were nice although the desk could have been a little bigger and the lighting a little stronger. But overall, nice location- I walked to the Galleria mall from the Embassy Suites and nice perks.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: docdocdoc
Reviews.Content: good hotel with great king bed and nice atrium. concierge level gives 2 free passes to breakfast. rooms are decent with nice amentities.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: MrsTexas
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how much I love this hotel! Large suites, Clean and comfortable, great location, and the SWANS in the lobby are just magnificent! I have stayed there now 3 times and continue to love it even more. The free breakfast is the absolute best. The beds are nice. I just love it. I hesitate to write this review because I don't want the hotel to be booked up when I need to stay here!Selfish, but the thought did occur to me.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the rooms were comfortable, and the breakfats buffet was decent, and included in the price of the room. We got a great price, shop online for good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel pay attention to bill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was real nice they send up your check out letter for $131.10 to your room and when they charged it to my card was $150.77 and I didn't use room service or drink the rooms water. I didn't use anything that wasn't suppose to come with the room. The place is lovely but watch your bill.
